Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain how identities can be influenced by people and places, and how we can create positive self-identities
Elaboration: Explaining how influential people may impact the way individuals see themselves and influence their developing identities, for example parents, friends, coaches, sporting role models and influencers (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain how identities can be influenced by people and places, and how we can create positive self-identities
Elaboration: Investigating how Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples identify within and across communities through connection to Country and Place, for example the 5 language groups of the Kulin Nation (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain how identities can be influenced by people and places, and how we can create positive self-identities
Elaboration: Examining how beliefs and cultural practices convey meanings for cultural groups, including Australians of Asian heritage, and contribute to the development of positive self-identities (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain how identities can be influenced by people and places, and how we can create positive self-identities
Elaboration: Exploring how connection to people and places can influence personal and cultural identities over time, for example how relationships and experiences influence self-esteem (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain how identities can be influenced by people and places, and how we can create positive self-identities
Elaboration: Exploring the positive impact of celebrating strengths and differences, rather than comparing skills, abilities and appearances (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate resources and strategies to manage changes and transitions, including changes associated with puberty
Elaboration: Understanding that experiences of puberty differ, and that the resources and strategies chosen to manage these changes are personal (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate resources and strategies to manage changes and transitions, including changes associated with puberty
Elaboration: Examining the strategies and range of products and resources available to manage the physical changes associated with puberty, including products for managing personal hygiene and menstruation (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate resources and strategies to manage changes and transitions, including changes associated with puberty
Elaboration: Understanding that physical changes experienced during puberty are linked to rites of passage ceremonies in many Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate resources and strategies to manage changes and transitions, including changes associated with puberty
Elaboration: Analysing how roles and responsibilities change as people grow older and examining strategies for managing these increasing responsibilities (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate resources and strategies to manage changes and transitions, including changes associated with puberty
Elaboration: Examining how the developmental changes that occur through puberty prepare a person’s body for reproduction (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how the portrayal of societal roles and responsibilities can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Identifying characters in texts who are not constrained by traditional gender stereotypes and how this influences their choices, actions and wellbeing (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how the portrayal of societal roles and responsibilities can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Questioning the fairness of gender roles and proposing ways to challenge those practices that infringe on an individual’s human rights (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how the portrayal of societal roles and responsibilities can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Investigating how social and cultural norms about gender can influence the roles and responsibilities of family members and people within their community (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how the portrayal of societal roles and responsibilities can be influenced by gender stereotypes
Elaboration: Identifying those gender norms that can have limiting and harmful effects, and proposing strategies to advance gender equality and respect for human rights (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and demonstrate how respect and empathy can be expressed to positively influence relationships
Elaboration: Exploring strategies for managing the changing nature of relationships such as starting a new school, changing priorities or interests, family break-up/separation or joining a new sports team (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and demonstrate how respect and empathy can be expressed to positively influence relationships
Elaboration: Recognising how words and labels used to refer to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples and other cultural groups can cause offence and how this awareness can support and strengthen respectful relationships (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and demonstrate how respect and empathy can be expressed to positively influence relationships
Elaboration: Examining the behaviours people demonstrate when treating others in respectful ways, and comparing these to behaviours that constitute forms of bullying, racism or gender-based violence (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and demonstrate how respect and empathy can be expressed to positively influence relationships
Elaboration: Assessing the impact of different relationships on personal health and wellbeing, and developing strategies to cultivate healthier relationships (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and implement strategies to value diversity in their communities
Elaboration: Proposing strategies to help others understand points of view that differ from their own and to encourage discussion about individual and cultural similarities and differences, to tackle discrimination such as sexism, racism and homophobia (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and implement strategies to value diversity in their communities
Elaboration: Exploring initiatives that sporting and cultural groups use to celebrate diversity, counter discrimination and racism, and support the wellbeing of their communities (MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and implement strategies to value diversity in their communities
Elaboration: Discussing the role upstanders can play in promoting respectful interactions and challenging disrespect and discrimination such as homophobia, transphobia, racism and that which is appearance-based (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and implement strategies to value diversity in their communities
Elaboration: Discussing and acknowledging the importance of cultural expressions of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples in maintaining a continuing deep connection to Country and Place and its influence on wellbeing (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe and implement strategies to value diversity in their communities
Elaboration: Examining how beliefs, values and cultural practices convey meaning and influence people’s sense of identity and belonging (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply strategies to manage emotions and analyse how emotional responses influence interactions
Elaboration: Exploring the emotions associated with feeling unsafe or uncomfortable and proposing strategies to manage these situations (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply strategies to manage emotions and analyse how emotional responses influence interactions
Elaboration: Analysing situations in which emotions can influence decision-making, including in peer-group, family and movement situations (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply strategies to manage emotions and analyse how emotional responses influence interactions
Elaboration: Exploring when emotional responses can be intense or unpredictable and practising strategies to self-regulate and manage expression of strong emotions (MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Apply strategies to manage emotions and analyse how emotional responses influence interactions
Elaboration: Analysing how appropriate emotional responses have a positive impact on relationships (MH, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe strategies for seeking, giving or denying consent and rehearse how to communicate their intentions effectively and respectfully across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Exploring the steps of seeking, giving or denying consent (asking, responding, listening and reacting) and practising how to communicate their intentions effectively at each step (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe strategies for seeking, giving or denying consent and rehearse how to communicate their intentions effectively and respectfully across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Practising and refining strategies for interpreting verbal and non-verbal cues related to seeking, giving and denying consent in a range of situations, including online (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe strategies for seeking, giving or denying consent and rehearse how to communicate their intentions effectively and respectfully across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Analysing how a person may react to being denied permission to do something (for example feelings of shame and anger associated with rejection) and discussing options for dealing with situations when this may occur (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Describe strategies for seeking, giving or denying consent and rehearse how to communicate their intentions effectively and respectfully across multiple settings (including online and offline)
Elaboration: Exploring strategies for effective decision-making (problem, choice, decision) when giving or denying consent (RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies that can be used in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Researching sources of health information and places where they can seek help at home, school and in the community, and prioritising those that are reliable and trustworthy, such as trusted adults, Kids Helpline, GPs, headspace, local council services and government websites (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies that can be used in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Examining ways to normalise and de-stigmatise help-seeking behaviour so they feel comfortable and confident seeking help when needed (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies that can be used in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Discussing strategies for maintaining online safety when using digital tools and digital media, including the options and processes for reporting negative or harmful behaviour (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies that can be used in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Exploring actions they can take when they feel unsafe when online, for example who to speak to if someone posts an embarrassing picture of them without permission or when to step away from negative online social interactions (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies that can be used in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Describing strategies they can use if they witness others in unsafe situations, such as accessing support networks or telling an adult they trust (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explain and apply protective behaviours and help-seeking strategies that can be used in a range of online and offline situations at home, school and in the community
Elaboration: Identifying and practising appropriate responses to unsafe situations, such as smoking and vaping (AD, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate different sources, quality and types of health information and how these apply to their own and others’ health choices
Elaboration: Examining how family, friends, media and public identities may influence the way people act and the choices they make in relation to their health (AD, FN, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate different sources, quality and types of health information and how these apply to their own and others’ health choices
Elaboration: Analysing the nutrient value of a variety of foods and discussing how different foods can nourish and fuel the body for daily activity, growth and strength (FN)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate different sources, quality and types of health information and how these apply to their own and others’ health choices
Elaboration: Identifying trusted people in their lives with whom they can share their health needs and concerns, and rehearsing ways to communicate concerns about their health to a variety of support people (AD, MH, RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate different sources, quality and types of health information and how these apply to their own and others’ health choices
Elaboration: Examining and comparing relevant health information and opinions, and identifying which aspects can be verified as accurate and reliable (MH, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse how various strategies influence the health, safety, relationships and wellbeing of individuals and communities
Elaboration: Recognising actions that can help keep classmates safe, including strategies to reduce potential for contamination, infection and anaphylaxis (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse how various strategies influence the health, safety, relationships and wellbeing of individuals and communities
Elaboration: Investigating school and community practices that help promote and maintain health and wellbeing, such as eating a wide variety of nutritious foods, meeting recommendations for daily physical activity and creating connections with others to enhance social health (FN, HBPA, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse how various strategies influence the health, safety, relationships and wellbeing of individuals and communities
Elaboration: Discussing and understanding how kinship and extended family structures for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples support and enhance their health, safety and wellbeing (RS, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse how various strategies influence the health, safety, relationships and wellbeing of individuals and communities
Elaboration: Scripting and rehearsing assertive communication techniques that can be used in a range of situations where they may be asked to do something they don’t believe is appropriate, such as smoking, vaping or drinking alcohol (AD, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse how various strategies influence the health, safety, relationships and wellbeing of individuals and communities
Elaboration: Proposing and implementing strategies to create positive peer environments in online environments (such as evaluating the impact of ‘character’ behaviour when gaming with peers) and in person, to raise awareness of the harmful impact of name-calling and other verbally abusive behaviour (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Analyse how various strategies influence the health, safety, relationships and wellbeing of individuals and communities
Elaboration: Selecting and practising appropriate strategies to promote safety in different situations, including in the home and in water- and traffic-related situations (S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt movement skills across a variety of situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Applying stability and locomotor skills to dodge and feint in different movement situations (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt movement skills across a variety of situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Performing activities that involve a transition from one skill to another, such as from dribbling to shooting or from leaping to balancing, in changing movement situations (CA, FMS, GS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt movement skills across a variety of situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Adapting kicking, striking and throwing skills to a variety of new games and activities (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt movement skills across a variety of situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Combining surface propulsion and underwater skills in an aquatic environment (FMS, HBPA, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Adapt movement skills across a variety of situations, including indoor, outdoor and aquatic settings
Elaboration: Using feedback to improve body control and coordination (AP, CA, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Transfer familiar movement strategies to different movement situations
Elaboration: Transferring defensive or offensive strategies that have been successful in one game to a similar game and considering the effectiveness of these strategies on movement outcomes in the new game (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Transfer familiar movement strategies to different movement situations
Elaboration: Examining and demonstrating how strategies used in one physical activity can be transferred to a new movement situation, such as hitting a ball into space in striking and fielding games and hitting a badminton shuttle into space on the opponent’s court (AP, CA, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Transfer familiar movement strategies to different movement situations
Elaboration: Transferring strategies to safely traverse obstacles in an outdoor environment (CA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Transfer familiar movement strategies to different movement situations
Elaboration: Making judgements, based on agreed criteria, about the effectiveness of transferring strategies from one game to another (AP, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how different movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be applied to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Demonstrating an understanding of how to adjust the force and speed of an object to improve accuracy and control (AP, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how different movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be applied to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Working with a partner to explore pushing and pulling movements and how these can be manipulated to generate and perform counterbalances (RE, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how different movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be applied to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Developing strategies that exploit the playing space to create offensive or defensive advantage (AP, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Investigate how different movement concepts related to effort, space, time, objects and people can be applied to improve movement outcomes
Elaboration: Adjusting constraints within a small-sided game to increase or decrease the time available for an attacker to make decisions when executing a movement skill (AP, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Create and perform a variety of movement sequences, modifying the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects
Elaboration: Composing movement sequences including balances to travel from point to point (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Create and perform a variety of movement sequences, modifying the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects
Elaboration: Creating a movement sequence that demonstrates variations in flow and levels, and involves individuals moving together in time (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Create and perform a variety of movement sequences, modifying the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects
Elaboration: Experimenting with different music genres such as Indian bhangra music when performing creative dances (RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Create and perform a variety of movement sequences, modifying the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects
Elaboration: Creating a movement sequence using equipment that shows changes in speed, direction and levels, such as on a beam, with a skipping rope or on an obstacle course (CA, FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Create and perform a variety of movement sequences, modifying the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects
Elaboration: Composing and performing a range of static and dynamic balances on different body parts, rotating and pivoting to change direction of movement (FMS, RE)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Create and perform a variety of movement sequences, modifying the movement elements of time, effort, space, people and objects
Elaboration: Modifying the elements of movement when performing athletic movement sequences such as those for long jump and hurdles (FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities to investigate the body’s response to different levels of intensity
Elaboration: Performing activities of different intensities and measuring breathing rate, heart rate and other body responses to categorise activities into low, moderate and high intensity (HBPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities to investigate the body’s response to different levels of intensity
Elaboration: Participating in physical activity circuits to explore how the body feels before, during and after participation (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities to investigate the body’s response to different levels of intensity
Elaboration: Designing and modelling different warm-up and cool-down routines for the class and discussing their importance for reducing the chance of injuries or soreness after activity (HBPA, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities to investigate the body’s response to different levels of intensity
Elaboration: Participating in and designing physical activity opportunities that support their health and/or fitness goals (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that enhance health and wellbeing in outdoor environments and aquatic settings and investigate the steps and resources needed to promote safe participation
Elaboration: Analysing how access to outdoor environments can influence participation in physical activities and enhance health and wellbeing (CA, HBPA, LLPA, MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that enhance health and wellbeing in outdoor environments and aquatic settings and investigate the steps and resources needed to promote safe participation
Elaboration: Discussing how a connection to a community space can influence the types of physical activity people will choose to participate in, such as links to skate parks, surf beaches or bushwalking trails (CA, HBPA, LLPA, MH)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that enhance health and wellbeing in outdoor environments and aquatic settings and investigate the steps and resources needed to promote safe participation
Elaboration: Participating in a swimming and water safety program at a local pool or beach environment and discussing how they can access aquatic environments safely and the different types of activities that can be undertaken in these environments (CA, HBPA, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate in physical activities that enhance health and wellbeing in outdoor environments and aquatic settings and investigate the steps and resources needed to promote safe participation
Elaboration: Exploring sociocultural factors that have an effect on enhancing health and wellbeing, such as community, peers, family, friends and cultural traditions (HBPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explore strategies to increase physical activity and reduce sedentary behaviour levels in their lives
Elaboration: Creating and participating in an activity circuit they could replicate at home that is designed to improve health-related fitness (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explore strategies to increase physical activity and reduce sedentary behaviour levels in their lives
Elaboration: Examining the benefits of physical activity for social health and mental wellbeing, and researching options for participating in physical activities in the local area, such as at school, local swimming pools, parks, gymnasiums and yoga studios (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explore strategies to increase physical activity and reduce sedentary behaviour levels in their lives
Elaboration: Investigating the resources needed and steps required to set up a lunchtime sports competition, activity circuit or playground games aimed at increasing levels of physical activity among students and staff (AP, GS, HBPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explore strategies to increase physical activity and reduce sedentary behaviour levels in their lives
Elaboration: Creating and participating in age-appropriate physical activities for whole-school/class theme days such as AFL days, mini Olympics and National HPE Day (AP, GS, HBPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Explore strategies to increase physical activity and reduce sedentary behaviour levels in their lives
Elaboration: Researching the Australian 24-Hour Movement Guidelines for Children and Young People, comparing individuals’ daily habits of physical activity to the recommendations and proposing strategies for enhancing or maintaining their levels of activity (HBPA, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Predict and test the effectiveness of applying different skills and strategies in a range of movement situations
Elaboration: Predicting and systematically testing a range of solutions to unfamiliar movement challenges, such as kicking a ball with different techniques and applying skills and strategies in different target games, to find out which solution is most appropriate or effective (AP, CA, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Predict and test the effectiveness of applying different skills and strategies in a range of movement situations
Elaboration: Adapting movement skills and strategies from other contexts to generate creative solutions to unfamiliar movement challenges when participating in activities such as frisbee golf or tchoukball (AP, CA, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Predict and test the effectiveness of applying different skills and strategies in a range of movement situations
Elaboration: Co-developing criteria to assess effectiveness of responses to movement challenges, predicting the effectiveness of each, then testing and refining solutions against the criteria in order to achieve successful outcomes (AP, CA, FMS, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Devise and test rules and game modifications to support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Discussing where and when they have witnessed fairness and inclusion in a game situation and explaining what led to the game being inclusive and fair (AP, GS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Devise and test rules and game modifications to support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Investigating the effectiveness of rules used in traditional games of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples to promote participation, such as inkanyi (a cooperative running game played by the Pitjantjatjara and Yankunytjatjara Peoples of central Australia in which there are no winners) and barambah gimbe (a throwing and catching game from the lands of the Wakka Wakka People in which catchers can be nominated to increase participation) (AP, FMS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Devise and test rules and game modifications to support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Proposing changes to the rules and/or conditions to create a more inclusive game or to allow for a fairer contest, such as modifying field, court or pitch dimensions (CA, GS, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Devise and test rules and game modifications to support fair play and inclusive participation
Elaboration: Interpreting and applying rules correctly in physical activities (GS, LLPA)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate positively in groups and teams by contributing to group activities, encouraging others and negotiating a range of roles and responsibilities
Elaboration: Exploring and performing the different roles and responsibilities in physical activities that promote enjoyment, safety and positive outcomes for participants (AP, GS, LLPA, S)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate positively in groups and teams by contributing to group activities, encouraging others and negotiating a range of roles and responsibilities
Elaboration: Using reflective listening and respectful communication when working in small groups on movement tasks or challenges (AP, GS, LLPA, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate positively in groups and teams by contributing to group activities, encouraging others and negotiating a range of roles and responsibilities
Elaboration: Exploring and performing the duties and responsibilities of different roles for a range of physical activities (CA, GS, LLPA, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate positively in groups and teams by contributing to group activities, encouraging others and negotiating a range of roles and responsibilities
Elaboration: Demonstrating effective communication skills when dealing with conflicts or disagreements in movement situations (AP, CA, GS, RS)

Subject: Health and Physical Education
ContentDescription: Participate positively in groups and teams by contributing to group activities, encouraging others and negotiating a range of roles and responsibilities
Elaboration: Proposing and implementing actions and behaviours that promote safe participation in physical activities (CA, GS, HBPA, LLPA, S)
